instructions: In a saucepan, heat the broth over medium heat.
In a separate large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, sautéing until softened.
Add Arborio rice, stirring until rice is coated with butter and translucent around the edges.
Pour in white wine, stirring constantly until absorbed.
Gradually add warm broth to the rice, stirring frequently until absorbed before adding more.
Add sliced mushrooms during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
Enjoy your Mushroom Risotto!
servingSuggestion: Pair Mushroom Risotto with a crisp green salad and a glass of white wine.

ingredients: 1 can (14 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (14 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic, sautéing until softened.
Add diced bell pepper and zucchini, cooking until vegetables are tender.
Stir in diced tomatoes, kidney beans, black beans, vegetable broth, chili powder, and cumin.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Simmer chili for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro before serving.
Enjoy your Vegetarian Chili!
servingSuggestion: Serve Vegetarian Chili with cornbread or over rice, topped with avocado slices and sour cream.

instructions: Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella on a serving platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve Caprese Salad immediately.
Enjoy your refreshing Caprese Salad!
servingSuggestion: Serve Caprese Salad as a light appetizer or side dish alongside grilled chicken or fish.

Add diced bell pepper and zucchini, cooking until vegetables are tender.
servingSuggestion: Serve Vegetarian Chili with cornbread or over rice, topped with avocado slices and sour cream.
